author: chris42
title: Cardano for Global Health Supply
description: The "Last Mile" problem in the campaign brief blocks delivery of diagnostics to prevent transmission of HIV, TB and other diseases in Africa

f6_assessments.q0: Yes, this proposal effectively addresses the challenge and if funded would have a massive impact on the Cardano community. As the Kountable system is already up and running in 6 major African countries, this integration could likely be quick and immediately provide value to the Cardano ecosystem and its users. The trust built by the proposers throughout the area will reduce barriers to adoption and increase the reach of Atala Prism by brining in new sectors. I appreciate the proposers' inclusion of the previous work they have done in this space, including its success, as well as their identification of the SDGs which will be addressed by their solution. This evidence of previous impact and attentiveness to global issues will likely resonate well with voters.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the experience and plan presented it is hard to definitively tell if the proposal will be implemented successfully. The existing product highlights that the company behind the proposal has experience and success in addressing the "last mile" problem of reaching rural and developing communities with necessary resources. However, the plan presented, while exciting, needs to be further developed and better explain how the Atala Prism integration will be conducted. It is not clear what is entailed to integrate Atala Prism into the existing program or how long that would take. Unfortunately there is also no real timeline for the work, neither is there a budget breakdown. For $50k voters deserve more than just a lump sum amount with no indication of how that number was reached or how it will be spent. Given the lack of critical information on these issues I neither agree nor disagree that it could be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunately, there is no real information for voters to audit the progress or success of the proposal. While the idea is clearly there and the company's track record suggests the proposers would be able to solve it, there is no way for the Cardano community to identify or track the outcomes. I appreciate the KPIs provided as part of the SDGs, however, this does not explain how the integration of Atala Prism would aid in achieving these. As the company clearly showcases their success in the "last mile" problem it could be inferred that many of these KPIs are not specific to this project but rather the company's operations writ-large. Moreover, as highlighted above, the lack of any indication for how the budget will be spent and on what causes me some concern, with voters likely to be weary of this approach. In order to increase the score, I would encourage the proposers to more clearly articulate how the community can be involved or informed of the progress and success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: This team wants to use distributed network and to match diagnostics supply transactions, local distributors, and capital with Cardano tools to unlock access to help prevent transmission of HIV, TB, and other diseases in Africa. This project and its problem are fit with what the challenge wants to address. And their KPIs can be fit with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team doesn't have a plan to show what they will do with this proposal. They're a great team that helps a lot of people, especially helped deliver 14M diagnostics to 3 African countries cloud tech, treasury, KYC/AML platform and digitized 3K trades $1.25B in value. 
To me, I have no doubt about their ability to deploy this project.
By for CA and vCA assess and fund, the team should have a plan to go and a detailed roadmap. That's basic!
The good thing is that the team attached a video of them, some images, and a website that we can visualize what they're doing and support. .
f6_assessments.q2:
The basic thing in a proposal the team should have for helping to audit it is the roadmap with a realistic timeline inspired key metrics/ KPIs - they had their goals very clear but lacked roadmap. 
Moreover, we want to know what big picture that your team wants to get with your project/ idea by clarifying that you have a well acknowledge of the problem context and have the solution with detail to solve it.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal clearly explains how UN SDG Goal 3 is addressed via an innovative implementation of the Atala family of technologies.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience of the proposers appears very appropriate - yet there is no actual plan presented with clear milestones and budget assigned to milestones by which progress can be tracked. We encourage the proposers to resubmit with a comprehensive plan detailing how the proposed work will unfold and how the budget requested will be spent at various stages of the plan.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPI presented are very generic and cannot be measured at this stage of the project because their accomplishment require a long time to determine (e.g under 5 mortality rate, etc). We encourage the proposers to resubmit including shorter term measures of success, or at least mention what they achieved in the long run along the respective KPIs so we get confidence in their estimate.

solution: Use distributed network and to match diagnostics supply transactions, local distributors, and capital with Cardano tools to unlock access
experience: Team delivered 14M diagnostics to 3 African countries through cloud tech, treasury, KYC/AML platform and digitized 3K trades $1.25B in value
